abstract: Obama administration urges Congress to reach deal on legislation governing National Security Agency's bulk collection of phone records before June 1 deadline, warning that failure to do so will leave United States vulnerable to terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration urged the Senate to reach an accord on the N.S.A. collection of phone data before Sunday’s deadline halting the program.

headline.main: White House Presses for Deal on Phone Data Bill
headline.print_headline: White House Presses for Deal on Phone Data Bill

snippet: The Obama administration urged the Senate to reach an accord on the N.S.A. collection of phone data before Sunday’s deadline halting the program.
